channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Energy prices are at zero to negative — but consumers aren't getting the benefits
item.description: Energy prices are low - so low, in fact, that they are in negative territory. But those savings aren't trickling down to consumers.
item.content:encoded: Energy prices are low - so low, in fact, that they are in negative territory. But those savings aren't trickling down to consumers.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Equality PAC raises millions to boost LGBTQ representation in Congress
item.description: We look at the Equality Caucus in the US Congress, which aims to increase representation in elected offices and pass laws protecting the LGBTQ community. (Story first aired on ATC on June 21.)
item.content:encoded: We look at the Equality Caucus in the US Congress, which aims to increase representation in elected offices and pass laws protecting the LGBTQ community. (Story first aired on ATC on June 21.)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: France's far right is gaining momentum for the first time since World War II
item.description: The political landscape in France is shifting, with a far right party continuing to gain momentum ahead of the country's snap parliamentary elections later this month.
item.content:encoded: The political landscape in France is shifting, with a far right party continuing to gain momentum ahead of the country's snap parliamentary elections later this month.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Taco prices are going up in Mexico and a certain soapy herb is to blame
item.description: A cilantro shortage has lead to a spike in price for the herb - and that is making tacos more expensive in Mexico.
item.content:encoded: A cilantro shortage has lead to a spike in price for the herb - and that is making tacos more expensive in Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Emily Green

item.title: California's ban on hidden 'junk fees' takes effect in July
item.description: In July, a new state law in California will require businesses to disclose all costs up front — a ban on so-called “junk fees” on everything from hotel rooms, to concert tickets, to restaurant food. Restaurants in particular are saying this will hurt their business.
item.content:encoded: In July, a new state law in California will require businesses to disclose all costs up front — a ban on so-called “junk fees” on everything from hotel rooms, to concert tickets, to restaurant food. Restaurants in particular are saying this will hurt their business.
item.dc:creator: Marisa Lagos

item.title: CDC report finds nursing homes lag behind in COVID vaccinations
item.description: COVID continues to menace nursing homes across the US. In a new report, the CDC found just 4 out of 10 nursing home residents have gotten an updated COVID shot since last fall.
item.content:encoded: COVID continues to menace nursing homes across the US. In a new report, the CDC found just 4 out of 10 nursing home residents have gotten an updated COVID shot since last fall.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Why the heat wave hitting the Midwest and the East Coast is particularly dangerous
item.description: A dangerous heat dome is coming to the Midwest and East Coast. It's particularly risky because it's happening early in the season, before many have acclimated to summer heat.
item.content:encoded: A dangerous heat dome is coming to the Midwest and East Coast. It's particularly risky because it's happening early in the season, before many have acclimated to summer heat.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Saturday Sports: Stanley Cup, remembering Willie Mays
item.description: NPR's Don Gonyea and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the Stanley Cup and remember baseball legend Willie Mays.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Don Gonyea and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the Stanley Cup and remember baseball legend Willie Mays.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Behind the scenes of Detroit's urban resurgence
item.description: Detroit's population is growing, a first since the 1950s. The uptick is small but significant for a city that's struggled for decades.
item.content:encoded: Detroit's population is growing, a first since the 1950s. The uptick is small but significant for a city that's struggled for decades.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: How women runners debunked myths about the sport and made running their own
item.description: For centuries, women weren't considered fast enough or strong enough to race. They've broken every barrier and disproved falsehoods about their fitness for the sport, in some cases outcompeting men.
item.content:encoded:
For centuries, women weren't considered fast enough or strong enough to race. They've broken every barrier and disproved falsehoods about their fitness for the sport, in some cases outcompeting men.

(Image credit: David L. Ryan/Boston Globe)
item.dc:creator: Maya Silver
